content.description: Sit or squat start with hands matched on a left-facing sidepull edge at the base of the crack, work straight up through good horizontal crack holds with good feet all around. Topout straight up and just to the right of the arete of Flowing Water.
content.location: On the front face of the Streambned boulder, if the stream is to your back. The climb starts just to the right of the arete, on the same start as Foggy Water Tribe Tune.

content.description: Similar to Riparian Retreat, stand start in the crack with crimps at ~chest height with good footchips below, pull on and then make your way straight up the face using any crimps you can find. Topout on jugs directly above the starting holds. This might be a bit easier for taller climbers as there was not a lot to work with between the starting holds and the higher holds on this wall.
content.protection: Maybe 1 pad? Tight fit in between the two halves of the rock.
content.location: Starting inside the crack of the Streambed boulder, on the side with Reservoir. Not visible from the stream/trail, you need to walk right up to the boulder/crack to see this problem and it's twin on the other side.

content.description: Starting inside the crack, on the side with Cloudburst and Downpour, stand start on crimps with different foot options, pull on and crimp your way up this vert face, avoiding the dab on the other side of the crack boulder behind you. Jugs at the top of the wall allow for an easy mantle finish.
content.protection: Maybe 1 pad? Tight fit in between the two halves of the rock.
content.location: Starting inside the crack of the Streambed boulder, on the side with Cloudburst and Downpour. Not visible from the stream/trail, you need to walk right up to the boulder/crack to see this problem and it's twin on the other side.

content.description: Sit start with hands on sloped edges and small feet below you, pull on and traverse right through good edges following the same feature from the start out to the right arete of this boulder. Once you link up with the arete, the feet get better and you move straight up the arete with good holds to layback on. Topout at the top of the arete, with good holds on the lip of the boulder.
content.protection: 2-3 pads, there is a small boulder behind you close to the landing zone.
content.location: On the hill side of the Streambed boulder, a few feet up the hill from Downpour, Cloudburst, and the two in the crack climbs. This line is the one closest to Quartz Blade on The Redeemer boulder just a bit further up the hill. If looking at this climb, the stream would be on your right down the hill a little ways.

content.description: Sit or squat start with hands matched on a left-facing sidepull edge in the crack, pull on with good feet and traverse up and right following the right angling crack up to the right arete, work up the arete, and rock over to top this climb.
content.location: With your back to the stream, this problem starts just to the right of the rounded arete on the left side of the main face, moving up and right through the obvious crack.

content.description: Stand start in the middle of the blunt arete, move straight up to the highest point of the boulder using good jugs and a variety of horizontal cracks in the rock. Well featured topout at the peak of the arete.
content.location: With your back to the stream, this problem is the rounded arete on the left side of the main face, the middle route on the wall if looking right at it.

content.description: Squat start, layback the right arete of the boulder with good feet below you. Work up good holds along the right arete until you meet up with the right angling crack from Foggy Water Tribe Tune and then continue up to the top of the arete for an easy rockover to finish this climb.
content.location: Starting on the right arete of the Streambed boulder, if the stream is behind you. This line follows the obvious right arete of the boulder.

content.description: Stand start at the base of the left arete, layback your way up jugs on the arete to good holds at the top of the boulder, rockover the top or around the arete at the top for an easy finish.
content.protection: 2-3 pads, there is a small boulder behind you close to the landing zone.
content.location: On the hill side of the Streambed boulder, to the left of Cloudburst and Flowing Water. If looking at this climb, the stream would be on your right down the hill a little ways.

content.description: Stand start just to the left of Flowing Water on good edges on the vertical face. Using a variety of good foot options, climb straight up the face using positive sidepull jugs and a crack holds to a jug topout. I avoided using the left arete, using so would make the climb a grade or so easier and also blend into Downpour the left arete climb.
content.location: On the hill side of the Streambed boulder, to the left of Flowing Water. If looking at this climb, the stream would be on your right down the hill a little ways.

content.description: Slightly shorter than Redeemer, The Streambed boulder hosts a variety of easier problems for anyone looking to get warmed up in the area and not wanting to have to stop at Sit Down or Pond Cave first to do so. The majority of the problems on the Streambed boulder are slab or face climbs with positive holds; the boulder does hold some trickier climbs, a few reminiscent of Lost Girls or Suzy B/Flakes.
